fr.ecp.Group52_Project_IS1220_part1_AVEROUS_TOPUZ.Model.Itinerary

Class Ride

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • fr.ecp.Group52_Project_IS1220_part1_AVEROUS_TOPUZ.Model.Itinerary.Ride
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Ride
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class is used for creating Ride objects. A Ride is used when a User wants to go from a point A to a point B using the myVelib system. He goes on a Ride, and the Ride he is on will provide him with useful information for setting his course : at which station to pick a bike up, to which station to go to drop it off, depending on the user's preferences.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pierre Averous, Nicolas Topuz

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ride

        public Ride(User user,
            GPScoordinates arrival,
            java.util.ArrayList<Station> allStations,
            ArrivalStationPreference arrivalStationPreference,
            PathPreferences preference)
        The constructor for making a Ride instance.
        Parameters:
        user - The User who is on this ride
        arrival - The GPS coordinates of where the user wishes to go
        allStations - An ArrayList of all stations in the current network
        arrivalStationPreference - The preference for the arrival Station (plus station or not)
        preference - The preference in the path to be taken to the arrival (Fastest or Shortest)

    • Method Detail

      • distanceToDeparture

        public double[] distanceToDeparture(java.util.ArrayList<Station> departureStations)
        This method gives you a matrix containing at index i the distance from your departure point to the station located at index i in the ArrayList departureStations that you put as input.
        Parameters:
        departureStations - The ArrayList of all stations with an available bike.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing the distances to departure stations.

      • distanceToArrival

        public double[] distanceToArrival(java.util.ArrayList<Station> arrivalStations)
        This method gives you a matrix containing at index i the distance from your arrival point to the station located at index i in the ArrayList arrivalStations that you put as input.
        Parameters:
        arrivalStations - The ArrayList of all stations with a free ParkingSlot.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing the distances to arrival stations.

      • getDepartureStations

        public java.util.ArrayList<Station> getDepartureStations()
        This method goes over all stations in the network, and returns an ArrayList containing only the stations, in which a bike is available for pickup. Those can then be used as departure stations for a ride.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing all stations with an available bike.

      • getArrivalStations

        public java.util.ArrayList<Station> getArrivalStations()
        This method goes over all stations in the network, and returns an ArrayList containing only the stations, at which there is room to drop off a bike. This search depends on the preferences the user has put in when creating the Ride. He can either choose to avoid Plus Stations, to prefer them, or to make a simple search with no preference regarding the arrival station.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing all stations with a free spot.

      • distancesUsedStation

        public double[][] distancesUsedStation(java.util.ArrayList<Station> departureStations,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<Station> arrivalStations)
        This method calculates the distances between all stations from the input ArrayLists, and returns them as a double matrix. Element at position (i,j) in the output matrix corresponds to the distance between departureStation index i and arrivalStation index j.
        Parameters:
        departureStations - The ArrayList containing all departure stations (available bike)
        arrivalStations - The ArrayList containing all arrival stations (available free spot)
        Returns:
        a double[][] matrix wit the distances between the departure stations and the arrival stations.

      • proceedPayment

        public void proceedPayment()
        This method updates the price of the ride inside the ride object.

      • proceedPayment

        public void proceedPayment(double timeOnBike)
        This method updates the price of the ride inside the ride object.
        Parameters:
        timeOnBike - The time spent on the bike as a double, in minutes

      • proceedCreditAttribution

        public void proceedCreditAttribution()
        This method proceeds to the attribution of bonus credits, depending on the station visited by the user upon his arrival.

      • startOnBike

        public void startOnBike()
        Method called upon when a user picks up a bike. It lets the payment center know the time at which the user picked up a bike, in order to compute the duration of rental of the given bike.

      • stopOnBike

        public void stopOnBike()
        Method called upon when a user drops a bike off. It lets the payment center know the time at which the user dropped off a bike, and then computes the duration of rental of the given bike.

      • updateArrivalChange

        public void updateArrivalChange()
        A method to update the arrival station of the ride, in case the last parkingslots at this station are taken by another user during the ride

      • updateDepartureChange

        public void updateDepartureChange()
        A method to update the parameters of the ride, in case the last bikes at the departure station are taken by another user during the ride
